perturbation.original_text: Affiliate(s) are the entities listed on Exhibit E to this Agreement that are either business units of Distributor (and therefore wholly-owned and a part of Distributor) or are wholly-owned subsidiaries of Distributor, but in either case, only for so long as ownership remains as defined in this provision.
perturbation.changed_text: Affiliate(s) are the entities listed on Exhibit E to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause 'that are either business units of Distributor (and therefore wholly-owned and a part of Distributor) or are wholly-owned subsidiaries of Distributor, but in either case, only for so long as ownership remains as defined in this provision', it creates ambiguity and makes it less clear WHO is considered an affiliate, creating confusion around legal responsibility.

perturbation.original_text: 6.5 In the event any provisions of this Agreement or any other agreement between Distributor and Cisco require that Cisco grant credits to Distributor's account, Cisco will grant such credit to Distributor's account. [*****]. Cisco will only consider debit memos initially received from Distributor during the time period associated with such request, as set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.5 In the event any provisions of this Agreement or any other agreement between Distributor and Cisco require that Cisco grant credits to Distributor's account, Cisco will grant such credit to Distributor's account. Cisco will only consider debit memos initially received from Distributor during the time period associated with such request, as set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the Confidential Information '[*****]' it removes the clarification of what will be credited to distributor's account, which can lead to financial disputes. This creates uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: APPENDIX 1 CISCO PROBLEM PRIORITIZATION AND ESCALATION GUIDELINE To ensure that all problems are reported in a standard format, Cisco has established the following problem priority definitions. These definitions will assist Cisco in allocating the appropriate resources to resolve problems. Distributor must assign a priority to all problems submitted to Cisco. [*****]
perturbation.changed_text: APPENDIX 1 CISCO PROBLEM PRIORITIZATION AND ESCALATION GUIDELINE To ensure that all problems are reported in a standard format, Cisco has established the following problem priority definitions. These definitions will assist Cisco in allocating the appropriate resources to resolve problems. Distributor must assign a priority to all problems submitted to Cisco.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the details about Cisco Problem Prioritization, it contradicts the statement that Cisco has already established definitions. This makes it so the Distributor cannot properly do its job without the proper guidance.
